Major_Arcs.title: Nan's Disillusionment and the Ghost Town's Fate
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Nan, her lament about lost dreams, and the impending demolition of the ghost town, setting up the initial conflicts and emotional stakes.

sub_scenes.title: Saloon Lament and Skeptical Response
sub_scenes.description: Nan expresses her disillusionment in a saloon, contrasted by a man's skeptical view of romance and changing times.

sub_scenes.title: Departure and Ghost Town's Modern Threat
sub_scenes.description: Nan abruptly leaves, while a new group of men arrive at the ghost town, revealing plans for demolition and airport construction, causing Nan distress.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at the Ghost Town and Development Plans

Major_Arcs.title: Nan and Cal's Evolving Romance Amidst Demolition
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc focuses on Nan and Cal's deepening relationship as they navigate misunderstandings and express deeper feelings, set against the backdrop of the ghost town's impending destruction.

sub_scenes.title: Misjudgment and Tenderness Questioned
sub_scenes.description: Nan and Cal discuss their romantic feelings, addressing misjudgments and exploring the meaning of tenderness in love.

sub_scenes.title: Demolition Confrontation and Father's Disapproval
sub_scenes.description: The scene shifts to the ghost town demolition site where Nan confronts workers, followed by a tense family discussion about business interruption and parental disapproval.

Major_Arcs.title: Seeking Clarity and Confrontation with Cal
Major_Arcs.description: Nan seeks comfort and advice from her mother, leading to a resolve to confront Cal directly about their relationship and the business deal involving horses.

sub_scenes.title: Mother's Advice and Nan's Decision
sub_scenes.description: Nan's mother comforts her, offering love advice and support, which empowers Nan to seek clarity from Cal.

narrative_arcs.title: Decision to Seek Clarity from Cal

sub_scenes.title: Pursuit and Father's Business Directive
sub_scenes.description: Nan pursues Cal, but is intercepted by her father who gives her business instructions regarding horses and a deal, setting up conflict.

sub_scenes.title: Relationship Ultimatum and Defiant Departure
sub_scenes.description: Nan confronts Cal with an ultimatum about their relationship and horses, leading to Cal's defiant departure and Nan's lonely reflection.

Major_Arcs.title: Reunion and Confession in the Snow
Major_Arcs.description: After weeks of separation and loneliness, Cal returns to Nan in a snowy setting, confessing his feelings and leading to reconciliation amidst weather concerns.

sub_scenes.title: Loneliness and Cal's Return
sub_scenes.description: Nan experiences deep loneliness following Cal's departure, which is then broken by Cal's unexpected return and confession.

narrative_arcs.title: Nan's Loneliness and Reflection on Cal's Absence

sub_scenes.title: Reconciliation and Weather Crisis
sub_scenes.description: Nan and Cal reconcile, but their reunion is overshadowed by the looming threat of severe weather and dwindling supplies.

Major_Arcs.title: The Great Snowstorm and Fodder Rescue
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts the onset of a severe snowstorm, the community's worry for the cattle, and the hopeful arrival of a plane dropping fodder, bringing relief and rekindling hope.

sub_scenes.title: Weather Alarm and Impending Crisis
sub_scenes.description: Characters at Mr. Wills' house discuss the alarming weather conditions and the threat to cattlemen, escalating worries about the storm.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at Mr. Wills' and Weather Report
Historical Context of Severe Snow and Impending Starvation
Cal's Resolve to Save the Cattle

sub_scenes.title: Despair and Hopeful Aerial Relief
sub_scenes.description: Characters indoors express despair at the relentless snow, but a sudden sound of a plane brings unexpected hope and relief with the delivery of fodder.

narrative_arcs.title: Sound of a Plane and Hopeful Discovery
Fodder from the Plane and Seeds of Romance

Major_Arcs.title: Chane Benson's Town Showdown and Jeff's Hero Worship
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Chane Benson and his violent street showdown, focusing on the town's varied reactions and Jeff's developing admiration for such figures.

sub_scenes.title: Street Fight and Town's Divided Opinion
sub_scenes.description: Chane Benson's public fight divides townspeople, with women intrigued and men debating his nature, while Jeff expresses admiration.

narrative_arcs.title: Chane Benson's Showdown and Town Reactions

sub_scenes.title: Jeff's Hero Phase and Father's Gun
sub_scenes.description: Sally and Clyde discuss Jeff's hero-worshipping phase and his fascination with guns, leading to Sally confronting Jeff handling their father's gun.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally's Reflection on Jeff's Youth and Clyde's Commentary
Jeff's Defensive Outburst and Clyde Insult

sub_scenes.title: Worries and Troubling Past Flashback
sub_scenes.description: Sally expresses deep concern about Jeff's behavior to Clyde, leading to a flashback illustrating Jeff's heightened anxiety and past disappearance.

narrative_arcs.title: Sally and Clyde's Worries About Jeff's Behavior
Sally's Flashback of Jeff's Troubling Past
Introduction to Mr. Benson and Ominous Advice

Major_Arcs.title: The Article, Benson's Threat, and Dinner Invitation
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc revolves around Clyde's controversial article, the escalating threat from Chane Benson, and the attempt to de-escalate the situation through a dinner invitation orchestrated by Er.

sub_scenes.title: Article's Repercussions and Sally's Fear
sub_scenes.description: Clyde faces angry reactions to his article, and Sally expresses deep fear for his safety due to Benson's potential violence.

sub_scenes.title: Escalating Threats and Dinner Strategy
sub_scenes.description: Threats against Clyde escalate, but Er proposes inviting Benson to dinner as a strategy to de-escalate and influence him.

sub_scenes.title: Deceptive Politeness and Betrayal at Dinner
sub_scenes.description: A superficially polite dinner with Benson gives way to Jeff's suspicion and Benson's menacing revelation to Sally, culminating in assault.

Major_Arcs.title: Jeff's Rescue and Benson's Downfall
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts the aftermath of Benson's assault, Jeff's intervention, and the ultimate resolution of the conflict through a physical fight and Benson's departure.

sub_scenes.title: Sally's Revelation and Jeff's Pursuit
sub_scenes.description: Sally explains the situation to Jeff, revealing Benson is her brother, leading to Jeff's determined pursuit to protect Clyde.

narrative_arcs.title: Chane's Threat and Assertion of Dominance
Sally's Rage, Chane's Departure, and Warning about Clyde
Jeff's Determined Pursuit to Save Clyde
Confrontation and Er's Plea for Restraint

sub_scenes.title: Fair Fight and Benson's Exit
sub_scenes.description: Jeff and Benson engage in a fistfight instead of a gunfight, leading to Benson's defeat and departure, and the town's reaction and reflection.

narrative_arcs.title: Jeff's Explanation to Sis about Clyde
Sally and Clyde's Conversation about Headline Change
Office Discussion: Newspaper Edition and Lessons Learned

Major_Arcs.title: Betsy and Steve's Ranch Conflict and Romance
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces Betsy and Steve, their initial conflict at the ranch, escalating tensions, and eventual romantic resolution as they navigate business and personal dynamics.

sub_scenes.title: Whip Fight and Steve's Arrival
sub_scenes.description: A whip fight precedes the introduction of Steve Daley at Betsy's ranch, setting a tense atmosphere and introducing new characters.

narrative_arcs.title: Discussion about Betsy's Job and Trouble

sub_scenes.title: Skepticism, Range War Warning, and Father's Disregard
sub_scenes.description: Betsy and Steve's interaction reveals Betsy's skepticism about Steve, warnings of range war, and Betsy's frustration with her father's decisions.

narrative_arcs.title: Offer of a Ride and Polite Refusal

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation with Bridges and Betsy's Realization
sub_scenes.description: Betsy's confrontation with Fred Bridges and his men escalates to a fight, leading Betsy to realize Steve is a hired gunslinger.

narrative_arcs.title: Confrontation with Fred Bridges and Fight
Betsy's Realization and Decision about Steve Daley
Betsy's Change of Heart Regarding Firing Steve
Hank's Gratitude and Betsy's Suggestion for Personal Thanks

sub_scenes.title: Conditions, Confession, and Romantic Climax
sub_scenes.description: Betsy sets conditions for Steve's job, leading to a confession of love, debate about Steve's gunfighter identity, and a romantic resolution.

narrative_arcs.title: Betsy's Conflicted Feelings about Steve's Gunslinger Identity
Declaration of Love and the Dilemma of Steve's Identity
Steve's Stance and Betsy's Plea for Love
Betsy's Unconditional Love and Steve's Wavering Resolve

Major_Arcs.title: Range War and Betsy's Assertive Stance
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc depicts the escalating range war conflict, Betsy's assertive confrontation with rivals, and her strategic decisions regarding gun usage and authority.

sub_scenes.title: Impending Trouble and Confrontation with Bridges
sub_scenes.description: Trouble looms as Betsy confronts Hank and Steve, accusing them of plotting to take over the valley, setting a confrontational tone for the range war.

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Declaration of War and Authority
sub_scenes.description: Betsy declares war, asserting her authority and control over gun usage, solidifying her leadership in the range conflict.

narrative_arcs.title: Reflection on Past Conflict and Gunfighter Identity

sub_scenes.title: Steve's Regret and Hank's Resolve
sub_scenes.description: Steve reflects on past mistakes, while Hank, motivated by Betsy, resolves to take action, escalating the conflict towards a showdown.

sub_scenes.title: Betsy's Justification and Journey to Devil's Pass
sub_scenes.description: Betsy justifies her acceptance of violence, leading to a journey towards Devil's Pass where a confrontation is expected.

narrative_arcs.title: Betsy's Justification and Steve's Reluctant Agreement
The Silent Journey and Cessation of Gunfire

sub_scenes.title: Devil's Pass Showdown and Captive's Fate
sub_scenes.description: At Devil's Pass, accusations fly and a captive's fate is debated, leading to implied violence and Betsy's fainting.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival at Devil's Pass and Accusation

sub_scenes.title: Recovery and Romantic Resolution
sub_scenes.description: Betsy recovers, and she and Steve express gratitude and affection, culminating in a romantic declaration and hopeful future.

Major_Arcs.title: Ranch Troubles and Carrie's Romantic Entanglements
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc introduces ranch troubles for Carrie and Dave, alongside Carrie's complex romantic feelings for both Dave and Fred, leading to a proposal and subsequent betrayal.

sub_scenes.title: Argument and Curley's Arrival with Bad News
sub_scenes.description: A personal argument is interrupted by Curley's arrival, bringing news of range trouble and setting up a new conflict.

sub_scenes.title: Fence Line Confrontation and Gordon's Threat
sub_scenes.description: Ranchers confront Fred Gordon about a fence, escalating tensions and hinting at potential violence over range disputes.

sub_scenes.title: Apologies, Reassurance, and Budding Romance
sub_scenes.description: After the standoff, apologies are exchanged, and Carrie and Dave's relationship deepens amidst reflections on recent events.

narrative_arcs.title: Apologies and Reassurance After the Confrontation

sub_scenes.title: Carrie's Assertiveness and Love Confession
sub_scenes.description: Carrie asserts her independence to Fred, followed by a heartfelt confession to Dave about her past and present feelings.

narrative_arcs.title: Dave's Support and Carrie's Confession of Love
Reflections on Past Misunderstandings and a Romantic Proposal

sub_scenes.title: Fred's Selfish Motives and Carrie's Rejection
sub_scenes.description: Fred's true, selfish motives regarding the Carlton contract are revealed, leading to Carrie's angry confrontation and rejection.

narrative_arcs.title: Fred's Strategic Proposition and Carrie's Initial Reaction
The Unveiling of Fred's Selfish Motives and Carrie's Betrayal
Carrie's Angry Confrontation and Rejection of Fred
The Confrontation with Fred and Dave's Unexpected Arrival

Major_Arcs.title: Carrie's Business Triumph and Romantic Choice
Major_Arcs.description: This major arc showcases Carrie's assertive business negotiation with Mr. Carlton, her victory over Fred, and her ultimate romantic choice between Dave and Fred.

sub_scenes.title: Confrontation with Carlton and Business Victory
sub_scenes.description: Carrie confronts Mr. Carlton about deceitful business practices and emerges victorious, securing her business future.

sub_scenes.title: Final Words to Fred and Chance Encounter with Dave
sub_scenes.description: Carrie dismisses Fred and encounters Dave in town weeks later, leading to a complex conversation about her feelings.

sub_scenes.title: Illness, Confession, and Romantic Resolution with Dave
sub_scenes.description: Carrie's illness leads to concerned visitors, a confession of love for Fred to Dave, and ultimately a romantic embrace and kiss with Dave.

narrative_arcs.title: Carlton's Account of Fred's Visit and Carrie's Rejection
Dave's Interrogation and Carrie's Love Confession
Dave's Pragmatic Advice and Carrie's Emotional Turmoil
Dave's Persuasion and Carrie's Plea for Affection

Major_Arcs.title: Dirk and Rance's Escape, Confrontation, and Reconciliation
Major_Arcs.description: This final major arc follows Dirk and Rance's escape attempt, their confrontation with the Marshal, and their eventual resolution in Mexico and back at the ranch with Chris.

sub_scenes.title: Dirk's Bullet Wound and Pursuit Realization
sub_scenes.description: Dirk's cryptic arrival reveals a bullet wound, and they realize they are being pursued, initiating their escape.

narrative_arcs.title: Arrival and Questioning at the Ranch

sub_scenes.title: Moral Dilemma and Temporary Truce
sub_scenes.description: Confrontation with Rance Cready leads to a moral dilemma about killing the Marshal and a temporary truce for Dirk's recovery.

narrative_arcs.title: Shift in Stance and Temporary Truce
Evolving Relationship - Night Encounter and Recognition

sub_scenes.title: Confession, Separation, and Pursuit
sub_scenes.description: Chris confesses love to Rance, but duty calls, leading to separation and a chase sequence as they are pursued.

narrative_arcs.title: Retrospective on Evasion Attempts and the Marshal's Ambush

sub_scenes.title: Gunfight, Dilemma, and Escape to Mexico
sub_scenes.description: A gunfight ensues, Chris is injured, and Dirk faces a moral dilemma, ultimately leading to their escape to Mexico.

narrative_arcs.title: Decision to Leave the Marshal and Reflection

sub_scenes.title: Rance's Unconsciousness and Romantic Resolution
sub_scenes.description: Rance is found unconscious, cared for by Chris and her father, leading to recovery, mutual confessions, and a marriage proposal.

narrative_arcs.title: Confession of Love and Proposal Tease

sub_scenes.title: Wedding and Dirk's Unexpected Appearance
sub_scenes.description: The wedding day arrives with the bride's anxious thoughts, the ceremony begins, and Dirk dramatically interrupts, leading to a final confrontation.

narrative_arcs.title: Walking Down the Aisle and Dirk's Arrival
Marshal's Wedding Gift and Dirk's Fate
Final Remarks on Dirk and Rance's Taste
